info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 2 at 5:01PM CDT until April 6 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Jacks Fork at Eminence affecting Shannon County.
Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County.
Gasconade River at Hazelgreen affecting Laclede County.
For the Jacks Fork River...including Alley Spring, Eminence... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Gasconade River...including Jerome, Hazelgreen...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Jacks Fork at Eminence.
* WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, flood waters impact City Park and other low lying areas in the city of Eminence.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 2.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 2.2 feet this evening. It will then rise to 2.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall to 2.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to 16.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Action stage is 6.4 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 515 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
